titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Another woefully wet day. I wrote the article on Church Reform, and despatched it to Edinburgh. I sawed wood with William in the afternoon. Wynne Willson reported himself indisposed, and I fear he has more on his hands than he can wisely bear. We dined with the Bannisters to meet the Dean & M
Waterfield, and had much pleasant conversation. He is a pleasant kindly man, disposed to be a good neighbour and likely to be popular. She is certainly an attractive and intelligent woman.
